terrier

Class ModifiedTerrier

  • java.lang.Object
    • terrier.ModifiedTerrier

  • public class ModifiedTerrier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses Terrier's functionalities to perform IR over a corpus.
    Author:
    Luiz Felix

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModifiedTerrier(java.lang.String terrierHome, java.lang.String indexPath)
      Installs terrier.home variable on the environment and load index file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModifiedTerrier

        public ModifiedTerrier(java.lang.String terrierHome,
                       java.lang.String indexPath)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Installs terrier.home variable on the environment and load index file.
        Parameters:
        terrierHome - The terrier home path
        indexPath - Path to the previously created index
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the indexPath points to an invalid index.

    • Method Detail

      • readQueries

        public void readQueries(java.lang.String queryPath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all TREC-queries into memory. The queries are lower-cased, stop words are removed, only stemmed unique terms are kept. The query file must be in the form: \n
        Parameters:
        queryPath - The path to the query file one by line, with ID
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if either the file doesn't exist or there's an IO problem

      • performQueriesWithStagedExpansion

        public void performQueriesWithStagedExpansion(java.lang.String outputFile,
                                              boolean useDocnoAsMeta,
                                              boolean doCHV)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Runs the read queries on the index using CHV-EMIM query expansion.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - Path to the output results file.
        useDocnoAsMeta - if the document name should be used as metakey on the output file.
        doCHV - if true CHV query expansion is performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the CHV file isn't found of if there's a fault while reading the index.

      • performQueriesWithoutExpansion

        public void performQueriesWithoutExpansion(java.lang.String outputFile,
                                           boolean useDocnoAsMeta,
                                           boolean doCHV)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Runs the read queries on the index without expanding them.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - Path to the output results file.
        useDocnoAsMeta - if the document name should be used as metakey on the output file.
        doCHV - if true CHV query expansion is performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there's a fault while reading the index.

      • writeExpandedQueries

        public void writeExpandedQueries(java.lang.String outputFile,
                                 boolean CHVOnly)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Expands the read queries using the staged expansion and creates a new file to be used with Terrier.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - The path to the new file to be created.
        CHVOnly - if true only CHV query expansion is performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there's an I/O fault either while expanding the query or writing the new file to disk.

      • tuneMu

        public void tuneMu(double sampling)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Automatically set DJM's mu parameter using the Tunner class.
        Parameters:
        sampling - The percentage of the corpus that is going to be taken in account while tunning. More is slower, but gives better precision.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's an I/O fault while reading the index file.

      • setInternalLambda

        public void setInternalLambda(double lambda)

      • setInternalMu

        public void setInternalMu(double mu)

      • getInternalMu

        public double getInternalMu()
        Returns the current value of mu used by DJM in order to score the documents.
        Returns:
        Returns the current value of mu used by DJM in order to score the documents.
